Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pictured \Pic"tured\, a. Furnished with pictures; represented by a picture or pictures; as, a pictured scene. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Picture \Pic"ture\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Pictured}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Picturing}.] To draw or paint a resemblance of; to delineate; to represent; to form or present an ideal likeness of; to bring before the mind. ``I . . . do picture it in my mind.'' --Spenser. [1913 Webster]
I have not seen him so pictured. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

pictured adj 1: seen in the mind as a mental image; "the glory of his envisioned future"; "the snow-covered Alps pictured in her imagination"; "the visualized scene lacked the ugly details of real life" [syn: {envisioned}, {visualized}, {visualised}] 2: represented graphically by sketch or design or lines [syn: {depicted}, {portrayed}]
